title: 820-0141 no backlight at power on. Sleep then wake and backlight
message:
As in the title. 

There is no backlight at power on.
Once the MacBook has gone to sleep and is woken, the screen backlight works again. 

I don't want to remove the board as I think Apple should deal with this one. However, I'm not sure about the consumer law in the country of original purchase. 

Anyone seen this problem?

title: 820-0141 no backlight at power on. Sleep then wake and backlight
message:
Possibly issue with SMC_LID signals.
You should first try to see if machine is under warranty.
I will not be surprised of T2 issue...

title: 820-0141 no backlight at power on. Sleep then wake and backlight
message: That's exactly what I thought. I was wondering if anyone had seen this before?

Ok, what I don't understand is how BKLT_EN can be there, but still no backlight. All other functions are working fine.
Sleep then wake and we have backlight. Restart we have no backlight until sleep / wake.... There must be a way t work around this.

title: 820-0141 no backlight at power on. Sleep then wake and backlight
message:
Did you try PRAM reset?
Also do SMC reset, if battery wasn't disconnected.
